1.text: Then the Lord answered Job out of a whirlwind, and said :

2.text: Who is this that wrappeth up sentences in unskillful words?

3.text: Gird up thy loins like a man : I will ask thee, and answer thou me.

4.text: Where wast thou when I laid up the foundations of the earth ? tell me if thou hast understanding.

5.text: Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?

6.text: Upon what are its bases grounded? or who laid the corner stone thereof,

7.text: When the morning stars praised me together, and all the sons of God made a joyful melody?

8.text: Who shut up the sea with doors, when it broke forth as issuing out of the womb :

9.text: when I made a cloud the garment thereof, and wrapped it in a mist as in swaddling bands?

10.text: I set my bounds around it, and made it bars and doors :

11.text: And I said : Hitherto thou shalt come, and shalt go no further, and here thou shalt break thy swelling waves.

12.text: Didst thou since thy birth command the morning, and shew the dawning of the day its place?

13.text: And didst thou hold the extremities of the earth shaking them, and hast thou shaken the ungodly out of it?

14.text: The seal shall be restored as clay, and shall stand as a garment :

15.text: From the wicked their light shall be taken away, and the high arm shall be broken.

16.text: Hast thou entered into the depths of the sea, and walked in the lowest parts of the deep?

17.text: Have the gates of death been opened to thee, and hast thou seen the darksome doors?

18.text: Hast thou considered the breadth of the earth? tell me, if thou knowest all things?

19.text: Where is the way where light dwelleth, and where is the place of darkness :

20.text: That thou mayst bring every thing to its own bounds, and understand the paths of the house thereof.

21.text: Didst thou know then that thou shouldst be born ? and didst thou know the number of thy days?

22.text: Hast thou entered into the storehouses of the snow, or has thou beheld the treasures of the hail :

23.text: Which I have prepared for the time of the enemy, against the day of battle and war?

24.text: By what way is the light spread, and heat divided upon the earth?

25.text: Who gave a course to violent showers, or a way for noisy thunder :

26.text: That it should rain on the earth without man in the wilderness, where no mortal dwelleth :

27.text: That it should fill the desert and desolate land, and should bring forth green grass?

28.text: Who is the father of rain ? or who begot the drops of dew?

29.text: Out of whose womb came the ice; and the frost from heaven who hath gendered it?

30.text: The waters are hardened like a stone, and the surface of the deep is congealed.

31.text: Shalt thou be able to join together the shining stars the Pleiades, or canst thou stop the turning about of Arcturus?

32.text: Canst thou bring forth the day star in its time, and make the evening star to rise upon the children of the earth?

33.text: Dost thou know the order of heaven, and canst thou set down the reason thereof on the earth?

34.text: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that an abundance of waters may cover thee?

35.text: Canst thou send lightnings, and will they go, and will they return and say to thee : Here we are?

36.text: Who hath put wisdom in the heart of man? or who gave the cock understanding?

37.text: Who can declare the order of the heavens, or who can make the harmony of heaven to sleep?

38.text: When was the dust poured on the earth, and the clods fastened together?

39.text: Wilt thou take the prey for the lioness, and satisfy the appetite of her whelps,

40.text: When they couch in the dens and lie in wait in holes?

41.text: Who provideth food for the raven, when her young ones cry to God, wandering about, because they have no meat?
